text: The flames exploded a day earlier into what is now the Park Fire, which has scorched more than 237 square miles near the city of Chico, California.

text: Butte County Sheriff Corey Hone says people near the Park Fire have been told to leave.
speaker: SPEAKER_16

text: There are 18 zones under evacuation orders in the unincorporated areas of Butte County.
speaker: SPEAKER_17

text: That's impacting approximately 4,000 residents.
speaker: SPEAKER_17

text: Meanwhile, further north in Oregon, authorities say a tanker plane crashed there while fighting one of the many wildfires spreading across several western states.
speaker: SPEAKER_16

text: A single pilot was on board and was found dead on Friday.
speaker: SPEAKER_16

text: Fires sparked by lightning struck areas of Oregon and Idaho.
speaker: SPEAKER_16

text: More than 110 active fires covering 2,800 square miles were burning in the U.S.
speaker: SPEAKER_16

text: on Friday.
speaker: SPEAKER_16

text: On Wall Street, the Dow up by 654 points.
speaker: SPEAKER_16

text: A House Democrat who condemned Vice President Kamala Harris on the border endorses her for president.
speaker: SPEAKER_16

text: More on this story from Mort Porter, Bernie Bennett.
speaker: SPEAKER_16

text: Representative Don Davis, a central North Carolina Democrat who often breaks with his party, endorsed Kamala Harris' presidential bid on Friday, one day after he joined five Democrats in condemning her handling of the southern border.
speaker: SPEAKER_15

text: Davis had backed the GOP effort to criticize the vice president's handling of the border on Thursday.
speaker: SPEAKER_15

text: He said in a statement, quote, the stakes of this presidential election are incredibly high with far-reaching implications, adding, quote, at the same time, the administration and Congress must address the concerns of the southern border.
speaker: SPEAKER_15

text: Additionally, he took the additional step of endorsing a vice presidential pick for Harris, North Carolina Governor Roy Cooper.
speaker: SPEAKER_15

text: Davis is a first-term lawmaker representing a competitive seat in northern North Carolina.
speaker: SPEAKER_15

text: Bernie Bennett reporting.
speaker: SPEAKER_15

text: News and analysis at townhall.com.
speaker: SPEAKER_16

text: I'm Keith Peters reporting.
speaker: SPEAKER_16

text: The Polish parliament has approved a new measure which authorizes agents on the Belarusian border to fire live ammunition at migrants for self-defense or in a preventive manner.
speaker: SPEAKER_16

text: Poland's new pro-EU government is proving to be just as tough on border security as its much-criticized right-wing predecessor.
speaker: SPEAKER_13

text: It prepared the changes following the death last month of a 21-year-old soldier who was stabbed preventing migrants from crossing the border illegally.
speaker: SPEAKER_13

text: The Interior Ministry says the use of firearms would only be justified if an officer's health was endangered under a direct assault.
speaker: SPEAKER_13

text: Rights groups say handing police and border guards increased powers to use their weapons without fear of prosecution would be a gross violation of human rights standards.
speaker: SPEAKER_13

text: The BBC's Adam Easton.
